culture.name: Fear is the Mindkiller - Kaja Sadowski
culture.description: Excellent book on building safe, inclusing and effective training spaces in martial arts.  Great resource whether you are an instructor/organizer or just looking for guidance in structuring your own training.

culture.name: The Theory and Practice of Historical Martial Arts - Guy Windsor
culture.description: Overview of studying historical martial arts, including instruction on working with historical manuals, skill development, safety and putting together training groups and classes.

instructional.name: TheTavernKnightsBarracks - Justin Aucoin
instructional.description: Recorded video lessons in Italian Rapier from instructor Justin Aucoin.

instructional.name: Fundamentals of Italian Rapier - David Coblentz and Dori Coblentz
instructional.description: A modern instructional manual containing both theoretical foundations and practical exercises for those interested in studying 17th century Italian rapier.

instructional.name: David Coblentz and Dori Coblentz
instructional.description: Recorded video lessons in Italian Rapier from instructors Dori and David Coblentz of the Decatur School of Arms.

instructional.name: Fighting with the German Longsword - Christian Tobler
instructional.description: A how to guide for learning the German longsword tradition based on the 14th century teachings of Johannes Liechtenauer.

instructional.name: The Medieval Longsword - Guy Windsor
instructional.description: A complete modern guide and system for training medieval longsword, drawing from 15th century manual Il Fiore di Battaglia, written by Fiore di Liberi in 1410.

instructional.name: The Duellist's Companion - Guy Windsor
instructional.description: A modern interpretation and training guide for the 17th century rapier system created by Capoferro.

instructional.name: Guy Windsor
instructional.description: A listing of the works of Guy Windsor, a well known Historical European Martial Arts instructor and researcher.  His work covers largely the Italian tradition across a number of weapons, including lonsword, rapier and dagger.

historical.name: Wiktenauer
historical.description: Collaborative website for collecting free to access manuscripts and translations relating to Historical European Martial Arts.

historical.name: Reinier van Noort
historical.description: A listing of works by Reinier van Noort, a teacher, researcher and practitioner of Historical European Martial Arts who has published a number of translations of historical manuals and books on the subject, focusing on Single Rapier from late 17th century German and the Netherlands, as well as Italian sidesword.

historical.name: Jherek Swanger
historical.description: A listing of works by Jherek Swanger, an interpreter and translator of historical treatises whose work focuses on 16th/17th century Italian swordplay, French small sword and Bolognese swordsmanship.
